intro: [WRONG START] Orchis × barlaa, commonly known as the hybrid orchid, is a naturally occurring cross between Orchis morio and Orchis anthropophora. It is a herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. The plant produces tall, flowering stems that bear showy, violet or purple flowers with a distinctive spurred lip. Its roots are fibrous and adapted for nutrient absorption in woodland soils. This hybrid is often found in moist, shaded habitats across Europe.
